pr_title: Move Flag/Mark icons to TopBar and reorder Flag

timeline.bodyText: Name might do with work. CardIcons?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message:
Hide Flag/Mark if shown in action bar

We use reflection as a best effort, and fall back to a heuristic if this
fails.

This stops duplication of the flag/mark icon in the UI.

timeline.bodyText:
This is on the API grey list for Android 9 and 10 (at least) https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base/+/pie-release/config/hiddenapi-light-greylist.txt#8509
Hasn't moved to blacklist but it's a warning for the future. Error handling during access needs to be different: https://developer.android.com/distribute/best-practices/develop/restrictions-non-sdk-interfaces#results-of-keeping-non-sdk
And we should have some sort of a test that serves as a canary for this in CI as I expect it will start throwing on higher APIs at some point
I am unsure how the support libraries are handling graylisting but I expect it may be the same
Perhaps since the only difference in the 3 blocks are the class name they could be somehow generalized as well, since the error handling will be semi-special having it coded once only would be a plus
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: I'll do some reading. I wasn't at all aware of this.
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Yeah - semi-new and only for people reflecting on internals. Might actually do with a comment on the source stack overflow post as it's a nice heads up for people, free internet points available. I only know because I have the nerdy habit of reading the entire "we have a new API!" notes google releases for each platform (they're quite illuminating actually?). I checked through the app before #4910 and we seemed pretty clean pending upgrades to the androidx dependencies so I just want to make sure that stays the case
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: The VM on the device will shut you down no matter how you attempt to touch off-limits APIs if they further restrict and I read correctly.
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: oh - if you mean to generalize things, that's a preference suggestion only really - nothing compared to handling API limits - falls into my "implementors choice" bucket
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: Error handling is all done via catch (Exception), so we're fine on this aspect
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Nope, the API restrictions throw Errors...they'd bubble out as of now
I exposed the latest API (R) in CI with #5953 so a test to tickle this just in case although I think it's still fine on R. In the future S might all the sudden be 'S'urprising though, unknown
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: I'll call that an Unknown Unknown until today 😉. Haven't done Java before (sans university projects). That's a massive gotcha, thanks!
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText:
Yeah - I don't like this structure really either, feels convoluted and fluffy at the same time
Definitely not a fall through, and might somehow throw an Error here as well?
How is it we will potentially have all 3 of these classes actually? Isn't it the case we will only have one of these classes? I would be curious to see which one of these is actually hit on API16 and API30 emulators as a quick check on the hypothesis that really only one class is ever in play
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText:
Two of the objects above are valid on my Android. I want to say that the support class is legacy and won't ever be loaded since we've moved to AndroidX.
I expect the other case would be hit if we don't extend AppCompatActivity.
But there's no inheritance between either of the MenuImpl classes that I can see (only a shared interface). Both should be impossible.
How would you propose a test for this? I'm tempted to go for:

Generate a new test-only activity

Extend AnkiActivity
Extend Activity


Expand the menu, pass it in, and see if it returns non-null.

Does that work for you?

I'll also want to change the code to use reflection to check for subclasses, rather than solely working off the type name. We could introduce a bug if we pass in a subclass of MenuItemImpl right now, which isn't typical, but is possible in the future.
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message:
Move Flag and Mark to top bar

Fixes #5806

Flag and mark were previously defined as SVGs in the HTML, this was not
ideal as it changed the layout of he cards when they were shown. Instead
we define these in the top bar.

Display "Flag" instead of "Mark" by Default

This default change only affects new users

MenuItem.SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM = 1
MenuItem.SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS  = 2

Keep "Edit Note" as first item in menu

Edit Note should have priority as the first item in the
"additional items" menu.
Move "Mark" icon to right of card

NF: Extract class: ActionButtonStatus

It's going to be a useful abstraction in the logic to check whether an
item is "always/ifRoom" for the top-bar icons, so might as well make the
logic more clear.
NF: Move mActionButtonStatus to subclass
NF: Clean up ActionBarStatus.setup
Made flag the default actionItem

NF CardViewer: Extract flag/mark data

This is to be overridden in Reviewer in a later commit
NF: Move mActionButtonStatus to subclass

Hide Flag/Mark if shown in action bar

We use reflection as a best effort, and fall back to a heuristic if this
fails.

This stops duplication of the flag/mark icon in the UI.
Switch Flag and Mark Positions
NF: ActionBarOverflow - Add debug logging

Handled Error and added regression check

We use a graylisted method, and errors will eventually be thrown
NF: ActionBarOverflow Fix PrettyPrinting

Remove Mark/Flag from CSS

Now in topbar.
Add additional tests to ActionBarOverflow

ActionBarOverflow: Remove support class
Add Error handlers for reflection
Convert isActionButton to accept subclasses
Convert isActionButton to accept subclasses

timeline.bodyText: So the way to get rid of the codacy issue is to put this in a try/catch, and instead of having comments that take you out of the code, you put those in the fail message inside the catch
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText:
Codacy doesn't support my AnkiAssert class which would allow that as an extension.
Will do anyway.
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message: NF: Codacy Fix

timeline.bodyText: Issue found: The utility class name 'ActionBarOverflow' doesn't match '[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]+(Utils?|Helper)'
timeline.author: timrae
